hints.content: Let's try each strategy one at a time to see if they work.

Add $32+10$ then add $40$.

> $\begin{align}\\
\greenD{32}+\purpleC{14}&=\greenD{32}+\purpleC{10}+\purpleC{4}\\
&\ne\greenD{32}+\purpleC{10}+\redD{40}\\
\end{align}$

>No, this strategy does **not** work.

Add $2+4$ then add $40$.

>$\begin{align}\greenD{32}+\purpleC{14}&=\greenD{30}+\greenD{2}+\purpleC{10}+\purpleC4\\
&= \greenD{2}+\purpleC{4}+\greenD{30}+\purpleC{10}\\
&= \greenD{2}+\purpleC{4}+40\\
\end{align}$



>Yes, this strategy works.

**The following strategy can be used to add $32+14$.**

- Add $2+4$ then add $40$.

question.content:
**Select any strategy that can be used to add $32+14$.**
